channel.title: Yale University on Landingpage-in-a-Box
channel.description: Recent content in Yale University on Landingpage-in-a-Box

item.title: Data from: Integrated species distribution models to account for sampling biases and improve range wide occurrence predictions
item.description: Abstract Aim Species distribution models (SDMs) that integrate presence-only and presence-absence data offer a promising avenue to improve information on species’ geographic distributions. The use of such ‘integrated SDMs’ on a species range-wide extent has been constrained by the often-limited presence-absence data and by the heterogeneous sampling of the presence-only data. Here, we evaluate integrated SDMs for studying species ranges with a novel expert range map-based evaluation. We build a new understanding about how integrated SDMs address issues of estimation accuracy and data deficiency and thereby offer advantages over traditional SDMs.
